intro: Pentameris andringitrensis, commonly known as the Andringa pentameris, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
